com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel
Interface IServoRuntime

All Known Subinterfaces:
ISmartServoRuntime
All Known Implementing Classes:
ServoDataSource, SmartServoDataSource
public interface IServoRuntime

IServoRuntime Data Interaction.

If under Windows the TCP connection is too slow, perform the following steps:

  1. From a command prompt run "regedit" and browse to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces
  2. Browse the items under interfaces until you find one that has an IPAddress entry matching the network interface you want to affect
  3. Right-click on the interface and select New > DWORD (32-bit) Value, name it
  4. Right-click the new TcpAckFrequency value and select Modify, enter "1" (Hexadecimal radio button should be selected)
  5. Right-click on the interface and select New > DWORD (32-bit) Value, name it "TCPNoDelay" (note that TCP is all upper case this time - that is intentional)
  6. Right-click the new TCPNoDelay value and select Modify, enter "1" (Hexadecimal radio button should be selected)
  7. Verify that both TcpAckFrequency and TCPNoDelay now show up in the adapter's property list with types REG_DWORD and values 0x00000001
  8. Reboot the Windows Installation

Method Detail

updateWithRealtimeSystem

long updateWithRealtimeSystem()
Synchronises the runtime data with data from the controller.

The data returned by the following functions is updated after the call of this method. Call these functions again to get the current data.

  • getAxisQMsrOnController()
  • getAxisTauExtMsr()
  • getCommandResultOfInterpolation()
  • getCurrentCartesianDestination(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame)
  • getCurrentCartesianPosition(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame)
  • getCurrentJointDestination()
  • getExtForceMsr()
  • getExtForceVector()
  • getExtTorqueVector()
  • getFineIpoState()
  • getRemainingTime()
  • getTimeStampOfUpdate()
  • getVariance()

Returns:
the timestamp in milliseconds. If invalid -1 is returned.

waitForTransferred

void waitForTransferred()
Blocks the calling thread until the command is transferred to the controller and the system is ready to response.

int getFineIpoState()
Returns the fine interpolation state.

Refreshed on updateWithRealtimeSystem().

Returns:
the state of the motion planner.

isDestinationReached

boolean isDestinationReached()
Inquires, whether target destination is already reached.

Refreshed on updateWithRealtimeSystem().

Returns:
true, if the last setDestination(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame) is already reached, false otherwise.

remaining time in seconds

Refreshed on updateWithRealtimeSystem().

Refreshed on updateWithRealtimeSystem().

setDestination

long setDestination(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame frameDestination)
Set a new cartesian frame as destination.

The reference system is the parent of the given frame.
Note: Calls updateWithRealtimeSystem() internally.

Parameters:
frameDestination - the destination frame
Returns:
timestamp in milliseconds

Refreshed on updateWithRealtimeSystem().

Returns:
the transformation of the current destination

changeControlModeSettings

void changeControlModeSettings(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.controlModeModel.IMotionControlMode controlMode)
Change current control mode parameter-settings.

NOTE: Only the same type of IMotionControlMode as on start of motion is supported. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
NOTE: In JointImpedance, only stiffness and damping can be varied online.
NOTE: In CartesianImpedance, only stiffness and damping can be varied online. It is not allowed to change nullspace stiffness and nullspace damping.

Parameters:
controlMode - the changed control mode

Supported online variable parameters.

  • PositionControlMode - no online modifiable control parameters
  • CartesianImpedanceControlMode - online modifiable control parameters
    • Cartesian stiffness: setStiffness
    • Cartesian damping: setDamping
  • CartesianSineImpedanceControlMode online parameters additionally to CartesianImpedanceControlMode
    • Force pattern riseTime: setRiseTime
    • Force pattern holdTime: setHoldTime
    • Force pattern fallTime: setFallTime
    • Force pattern amplitude: amplitude
    • Force pattern bias: bias
    • Force pattern frequency: frequency
    • Force pattern phase: phase
    • Force limit: forceLimit
    • Position limit: positionLimit
  • JointImpedanceControlMode online modifiable parameters
    • Joint-specific stiffness: setStiffness
    • Joint-specific damping: setDamping

stopMotion

boolean stopMotion()
Stops the servo motion.

Returns:
true if the servo motion is stopped

setMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime

void setMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime(double minimumTrajectoryExecutionTime)
Set the minimal trajectory execution time.

This describes the minimal time to reach the set-point to avoid "stepper motion".
Default value is 0.01s and maximum value is 0.1s .

Parameters:
minimumTrajectoryExecutionTime - time in seconds

getMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime

double getMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime()
Returns the current setting of the minimal trajectory execution time.

Returns:
time in seconds

setDetailedOutput

void setDetailedOutput(int levelOfVerbosity)
Configure the level of details which are displayed by calling toString().

Parameters:
levelOfVerbosity - debug level
  • 1: spare info
  • 2: additional info
  • 3: extended info

    inquireComplianceParameter

    java.lang.Double[] inquireComplianceParameter()
    Inquires the parameters for impedance control.

    Returns:
    the compliance parameters for the current motion control mode
    This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

    Works only in TestMode
